values:
oh you know, especially when that same old LJ friend you've been babbling about on here is actually sitting next to you on the train.


awkward. namely when you want to pipe up and say something but nah.....

Monday morning, all nearly wrapped up in a pair of huge headphones, red cardigan and tortoiseshell sunglasses.

Front train carriage. There he is, tartan cap, sunglasses and his nose in a book. It's been twelve years since those crazy little late night online conversations occurred.

Wry smile, shrugging of shoulders and a sigh.

No-one uses LJ anymore anyway. Funny how she still remembers him. Pity they drifted apart. Tsk.
That uncanny awkward moment when an old LJ friend is sitting next to you on the train. Hmm.

almost hit flirty-six. no regrets and if you've got an issue with me, you can EADC. gearing up for a holiday and exhibiting some photos at a mate's exhibition.

I saw you suited up at Flinders St and wanted to say hi but then I thought to myself "fuck it, you still HATE me anyway'.

Feeling a little lonely tonight. I'd blame the weather and all but I love the cold. Perhaps dusting off a bottle of Moscato while going through an old box of letters and knickknacks from over fifteen years ago has made this ol' boozehound a little sad.

Yeah...whatever..
happy birthday, where you may be. i hope it's filled with smiles, joy and cake
Hook. Line and STINKER. That is all.

got to love new social networks that will more than likely take over haggard old social networks. best bit is reserving a username for a tiny $36 a year and boom, not much anyone else can do about it.

did I mention that I love app.net?

I don't where I'd be with my bf and app.net. Hmmm, actually I do know -- more than likely on twitter, hiding behind a shower curtain and single. heh.

I love life.

not one to read the serald-hun paper but jaysus almighty, saw a photo of a whale of a woman that le ex got hitched to.

thank heavens for being a trim size 10 in my mid thirties.

/pats flat belly

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

One hundred and forty characters aren't enough sometimes when it comes to some good ol' interweb style ranting, hence why I gave twitter the heave-ho.

For some strange reason, ever since I checked out Godspeed You! Black Emperor at the Forum last Friday night, the urge to rant and take pics has come back. Just like old times but this time around, the majority of the rants are getting flung into ye olde tumblr account where teeny tiny little audience can read, like and leave insults err, fanmail/comments.

That's not to say that I won't be shoving a rant or three in here because....well....I can.

I'm all too happy to give out ye olde tumblr URL. All you need to do is throw the usual insults/comments my way here.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Been twitter-free for almost sixty days. Wondering if I can make it to a whole year? All twitter apps have been deleted from iPhone and Nexus 7.

Stuff's getting easier by the day.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

A bottle of wine emptied every night for longer than I care to remember. Using the old excuse of "it helps me get to sleep". 2013 and what do I have to show for it. Eight years doing the same old thing, in the same old place to earn a pay-cheque to fund the bottles of wine that get emptied every night without fail.

Some nights I catch myself off guard looking at old photos, lamenting what could've been. Every so often, I read his Twitter feed. He's living the dream. Lots of work, lots of money and will be a millionaire before he's 40. A beautiful family and not a care in the world. The easy life.

Back then I didn't have the guts to tell him that I would've said "yes" if he has asked. If he didn't write that venomous Deadjournal (and especially write about MY family) perhaps things would've been ok. I wonder if he even gave two shits about how much he hurt me.

No big deal. He doesn't read this. Why should he? He wouldn't even remember me.

Sitting alone in the dark, sound system cranked. The late great James Freud of the Models said it best in the song "Barbados"

"All I see, is washed away....I am the voice, from drinking...."

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

A friend of a friend pointed me towards a Twitter account of someone who meant a great deal to me years ago.

November. Such a rough month. I wonder if he remembers. Meh, probably not. Probably should stop reading his twitter account too.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

mid life thrisis or wretched insomnia. have to be out the door in five hours. can't sleep and I don't hate you. in all honesty, I want to reveal my twitter identity. then again, nah.

Might find the guts to ask you out for a coffee. You deserve an apology.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

I saw someone from afar tonight that part of me wanted to quietly wander up to and say hi. Another part of me thought about the repercussions. Not like they would remember me anyway.

Ah well, give it another eleven years or something. I might even not wear my big eff-off headphones this time and even reveal my twitter nick on here.

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Nostalgia, thou art a temptress. The urge to recommence writing in here is stronger than ever.

Hmm. Now what?

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Oh hai El-Jay! Long time, no update. Do people even El-Jay anymore or has the interwebz become a huge social media mish-mash of TwitterTumblrFacebookOMFGupdatethatshitonyouriPhone?

Anyhoo...I only remembered that I still had this thing after watching the fillum "The Social Network" for the umpteenth time on Bluray. The little mention of El-Jay made me titter slightly. I remembered why I gave up writing in here and moved onto Twitter back in 2007. Add to that, I also have a somewhat popular Tumblr blog that I prefer to be a snarky old bitch in.

Reading back over a few El-Jay posts from 2001 has given me a severe case of the lolwuts. I'm not afraid to admit that I was manic, quietly besotted with a bloke who himself was besotted with trains (I wonder whatever happened to him...did he end chasing his dream of becoming a loco sparky or something?) and I had the time to pursue my creative dreams.

Fuck how times change and people move on in awesome ways. I hit six years at my place of wage slavery a little while ago. If there's one grouse thing about my job, it pays for all the alcohol I tend to guzzle down. Life's a fucking party. I've got a good job, I've got some grouse mates and I'm pretty much rawking out without hubby or rugrats in tow. No regrets whatsoever.

What I'm trying to say is that I'm comfortable with my life and should be comfortable with yours too. Don't spend your life, constantly dwelling on the What Ifs. Trust me, I used to do that and I hit such a low point after I broke up with that train loving bloke.

To quote my late father who always gave me good advice - "Keep going"

...and that's what I intend to keep on doing.

Peace out,

- m

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.

Happy tenth anniversary, little livejournal account. We've had some interesting times together and even though you've been ditched for a tumblr and twitter account, you're still pretty ace and you were there for me when life got a bit hectic.

Happy tenth anniversary, little one.

/waves to LJ pals past and present. Thanks for the memories! :)

Posted via LiveJournal app for iPhone.
I'm 30 in t-minus 8.5 days. Ok scared now. How the heck did that happen, eh?

....some person shoots dead one person and critically injures two other people right in front of the intersection that faces my workplace.

The scene that I was greeted with this morning was something out of The Bill, sans dodgy British accents. Loads of cops, helicopters flying overhead, paramedics and the firies. Those of us that were waiting around to be let into work this morning were sent home. 

Pretty screwed up situation. :(

I remember you. How long ago was it? Four years? Maybe five? It seems so long ago that I can't remember. You were still in uni and I was...I was..."interested". I wanted to meet you but it was just.....just me...nervous and shy. How old were you back then? 19, wasn't it? I was secretly falling head over heels but I couldn't say a word. I mean, who goes around saying "hi, i like you. wanna meet up over some pricey caffeinated beverage in a classy part (Carlton?) of town?"

The years went by and I stopped using this thing. There was so much to write about but past experiences made me feel so disconnected from this medium. I hung around Hosier Lane with my digital camera, snapping stencil art or walking the streets in search of beauty. A drain here, an old building there. If the footpath beneath my feet could talk, it would no doubt have a million and one stories to tell.

I still thought of you every so often when I was riding the train out to Box Hill. Going past Glenferrie station always seemed to make me smile wryly and I'd lean my head against the window, daydreaming about you.

That was a long time ago and so much has happened since then. Work, music and being a drunken lout on Friday nights makes up much of my life at the moment. My 10 to 6er pays the bills. I haven't hung around Hosier Lane for so long and my digital camera sits in its bag in the corner, wondering when it will be let out to play for a while. I'm fast approaching 30 and with it, I'm a lot more cynical about life. I look back and try to recall those nights we used to msn each other silly and I can't help but smile. If you knew where I was working now, you'd probably spit on me or worse still, diss me to the high hills. If you could talk to me now, you'd notice that the bounce in my voice that was there five years ago has long disappeared. I'm sounding exhausted and husky these days. 

There I was, trawling LJ and there you were. A sparse amount of words, a lone picture. Everything's changed. Or has it.

I remember you. I wonder if you remember me.
To write or not to write in here? That is the question. Or do I just throw an almighty hissyfit and either continue quasi-blogging over in boring blogland or wander off to vox?

Once upon a time....way before "emo".....there was an Aussie band called Ratcat and I had the hugest crush on the lead singer, Simon Day. I can't believe that their album "Tingles" was released 16 years ago.
http://www.youtube.com/v/CAKMOoKmXm8
I still go slightly ga-ga over guys with floppy hair....rowrr

29 in t-minus 1 and a half days. Hate to say it but I'm kind of excited. 

Word.

• Beer (Asahi Super Dry)
  • corn chips
  • extra hot salsa
  • inking up a character for a work project
  • pure unadulterated aural sex
  • infiltrating Macedonia, Russia and Belgium via blips and squeaks
WHERE MY NINJAS AT?
